definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.chinese: 榆树大街橡树大街交界处聚众斗殴。

sentences.english: The argument culminated in a fist fight.
13 men, including 3 natives of Xinjiang, were detained for participating in the fight.
sentences.chinese: 其中13人参与了集体斗殴，包括3名新疆籍人员。

sentences.english: In a fight to save in Bai Yang and lentils.
sentences.chinese: 在一次打架斗殴中杨林为了救白文得罪了沈庆和扁豆。

sentences.english: The crime of affray can only be constituted with direct intention .
sentences.chinese: 聚众斗殴罪只能由直接故意构成。

sentences.english: Even to grab channel, include to fight the circumstance of affray has.
sentences.chinese: 甚至为了抢渠道，包括打架斗殴的情况都有。

sentences.english: The subject who may commit the affray Crime is ringleader and active participant.
sentences.chinese: 聚众斗殴罪的主体是首要分子和积极参加者。

sentences.english: Due to the fighting, HanShaoGong get into prison.
sentences.chinese: 由于打架斗殴，韩绍功被弄进了监狱。

sentences.english: Soldiers got in a fight and busted up the bar.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们参加斗殴并毁坏了酒吧间。

sentences.english: Girls in gangs are just as likely to participate in beatings as boys.
sentences.chinese: 加入帮派的女孩很有可能像男孩一般参与斗殴。

sentences.english: From whence come wars and fightings among you?
sentences.chinese: 你们中间的争战斗殴，是从那里来的呢。

sentences.english: For example, they may help us to understand some of the psychological causes of gay-bashing.
sentences.chinese: 例如，这或许有助于我们理解同志斗殴的生理学原因。

sentences.english: He got a black eye in the fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在斗殴时被打得眼眶发青。

sentences.english: We began to struggle for the bag and a fight broke out.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们开始争抢那个包，一场斗殴发生了。

sentences.english: There have been scuffles at such venues across America in recent days.
sentences.chinese: 最近几天在美国各地的市政厅都时有斗殴事件发生。

sentences.english: Contrary to some reports, there were only isolated cases of looting and fighting.
sentences.chinese: 与一些报道相反，抢劫和斗殴事件非常少见。

definition: to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
(dialect) to come to blows/to have a row
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
